attributes.action: Change laws to fine fuel companies making profit from motorists
attributes.additional_details: Government need to start dining any fuel company putting up prices due to circumstances and just using this as a means to make higher profits on the back of motorists
attributes.background: supermarkets fuel prices higher than some main stream stations I.e BP, Shel etc. fines should be imposed on profiting under current circumstances

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about fuel prices, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Businesses selling fuel are private businesses that sell fuel to make a profit, and it's not clear when you want fines to be imposed.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Set up an independent regulator to monitor and regulate vehicle fuel pricing: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605282

Cap profit fuel forecourt operators can make on petrol and diesel to 10p/litre: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616956
